snippet: Fortunes and buildings have been sinking in Dyess, Ark., but officials hope a heritage site dedicated to the singer and the town’s history as a farmers colony might change that.
abstract: Officials in Dyess, Ark, are hoping a heritage site dedicated to boyhood home of Johnny Cash and to town's history as a farmers colony will lift community where fortunes and buildings have been crumbling.
lead_paragraph: Fortunes and buildings have been sinking in Dyess, Ark., but officials hope a heritage site dedicated to the singer and the town’s history as a farmers colony might change that.

headline.main: Home of Johnny Cash Hopes History Will Help It Rise
headline.print_headline: Home of Man in Black Hopes He’ll Keep It Out of the Red
